text: Sepp Maier (born 28 February 1944) is a former German football player. He played for Bayern Munich and the German national team. He is regarded as one of the greatest goalkeepers of all time. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League DFB- Pokal Europe Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Bayern Munich 1962–63 Oberliga Süd 4 0 — 1 0 — 5 0 1963–64 Regionalliga Süd 23 0 — 7 0 6 0 36 0 1964–65 36 0 — — 6 0 42 0 1965–66 Bundesliga 31 0 6 0 — — 37 0 1966–67 34 0 5 0 9 0 — 48 0 1967–68 34 0 4 0 8 0 — 46 0 1968–69 34 0 6 0 — — 40 0 1969–70 34 0 3 0 2 0 — 39 0 1970–71 34 0 7 0 8 0 — 49 0 1971–72 34 0 5 0 8 0 — 47 0 1972–73 34 0 5 0 5 0 3 0 47 0 1973–74 34 0 4 0 10 0 — 48 0 1974–75 34 0 3 0 7 0 — 44 0 1975–76 34 0 7 0 9 0 2 0 52 0 1976–77 34 0 4 0 6 0 4 0 48 0 1977–78 34 0 3 0 6 0 — 43 0 1978–79 34 0 1 0 — — 35 0 1979–80 0 0 0 0 0 0 — 0 0 Career total 536 0 63 0 86 0 21 0 706 0 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals West Germany 1966 3 0 1967 4 0 1968 5 0 1969 6 0 1970 9 0 1971 8 0 1972 7 0 1973 5 0 1974 12 0 1975 6 0 1976 6 0 1977 8 0 1978 12 0 1979 4 0 Total 95 0 ==References== Category:1944 births Category:Living people Category:German association football goalkeepers Category:Sportspeople from Bavaria Category:Association football goalkeepers
